steps.description: Set up a Python development environment on Windows, including the installation of Python and any necessary IDE or text editor.
Initialize a new Git repository for version control and set up the directory structure for the project.
Create a virtual environment for the Python project to manage dependencies.
Install the Bitstring library and ensure it's working properly in the development environment.
Design and implement the bitboard data structure for chessboard representation using a 32-bit integer for each row.
Implement the game logic, including the rules of chess and move validation algorithms.
Develop the console-based user interface for input and output handling using Unicode characters to represent chess pieces.
Implement game state management to track and update the state of the game after each move.
Write unit tests for the bitboard data structure to ensure correct initialization and manipulation of the chessboard.
Create automated tests for the game logic to validate the implementation of chess rules and move validation.
Develop automated tests for the user interface to check for proper input handling and display of the chessboard and pieces.
Set up continuous integration to run tests automatically on every commit to the main branch.
Profile the application to identify and optimize any performance bottlenecks in memory usage and move generation algorithms.
Document the bitboard data structure and its operations in the project's codebase.
Write comprehensive documentation for the game logic, including how moves are validated and the game state is updated.
Create a user manual that explains how to interact with the console-based user interface and how to play the game.
Ensure that all automated tests have appropriate comments and documentation to explain their purpose and methodology.
